events.title: First Italian War Begins
events.description: King Charles VIII of France crosses the Alps with an army, initiating the First Italian War aiming to claim the Kingdom of Naples.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of prolonged French involvement in Italy and numerous European conflicts.

events.title: Charles Dickens Born
events.description: Charles Dickens, the influential English novelist and social critic, is born in Portsmouth, England.
events.significance: Dickens' works shaped Victorian literature and highlighted social issues of his time.

events.title: The Beatles Arrive in the United States
events.description: The Beatles land at JFK Airport in New York, marking the start of Beatlemania in America.
events.significance: This event triggered a cultural revolution in music and youth culture globally.

events.title: Russian Soyuz 4 and Soyuz 5 Manned Spaceflight and Docking
events.description: The Soviet spacecraft Soyuz 4 and Soyuz 5 successfully docked, allowing crew transfer in orbit.
events.significance: First successful docking and crew transfer between two manned spacecraft, a milestone in space exploration.
